sentences.sentence: Rumpelstiltskin
There was once a miller( 磨坊主 ) who was poor, but who had a beautiful daughter.
One day the King happened to( 碰巧 ) be passing, and noticed the miller’s daughter.
“What beautiful golden hair your daughter has! The yellow hair of most girls looks like straw( 稻草 ), but your daughter’s really looks like gold.” said the King to him.
And the miller, because he was nervous and wanted to make himself and his family seem more important, replied, “Yes indeed, King.
And not only that—she is also able to spin( 纺 ) straw into gold.”
The King replied, “That is a very useful skill. If your daughter is really able to do what you say, bring her to my castle( 城堡 ) tomorrow, and I will test her.”
When the girl was brought to him, he led her into a room that was full of straw, and gave her a spinning wheel and spindle( 纺锤 ), and said,
“Now start to work, and if by the early morning you have not spun this straw into gold, you shall die.”
“But . . .” the girl started to say.
“Your father says you can do this. Are you calling him a liar?” asked the King.
And the girl was silent, because how could she call her own father a liar, in front of the King?
Then the King shut the door, and left her there alone.
And so the poor miller’s daughter was left there, and could not think what to do to save her life.
She had no idea how to spin straw into gold, and her distress( 忧虑 ) grew so great that she began to cry.
Then suddenly the door opened, and in came a little man, who said,
“Good evening, miller’s daughter. Why are you crying?”
“Oh!” answered the girl. “I have got to spin gold out of straw, and I have no idea how to do it.”
Then the little man said,
“What will you give me if I spin it for you?”
“My necklace( 项链 ),” said the girl.
The little man took the necklace, seated himself before the wheel, and whirr( 嗡嗡地响 ), whirr, whirr!
Three times round and the bobbin( 线轴 ) was full.
Then he took up another, and whirr, whirr, whirr!
Three times round, and that was full.
So he went on till the morning, when all the straw had been spun, and all the bobbins were full of gold.
At sunrise( 日出 ) the King came in, and when he saw the gold he was astonished( 震惊的 ) and very happy, because he was a very greedy( 贪婪的 ) man.
He had the miller’s daughter taken into another room filled with straw, much bigger than the last, and told her that if she valued her life, she must spin it all in one night.
The girl did not know what to do, so she began to cry.
Then the door opened, and the little man appeared and said,
“What will you give me if I spin all this straw into gold?”
“The ring from my finger,” answered the girl.
So the little man took the ring, and began again to send the wheel whirring round, and by the next morning all the straw was spun into brightly-shining gold.
The King rejoiced( 充满喜悦 ) greatly at the sight, but as he could never have enough gold, he had the miller’s daughter taken into a still larger room full of straw, and said,
“This, too, must be spun in one night, and if you spin it all, you shall be my wife.”
For he thought, “Although she is only a miller’s daughter, I am not likely to find any one richer in the whole world.”

question.cn: 为什么磨坊主要欺骗国王？
question.en: Why did the miller cheat the king?

options.cn: 因为他想抬高自己和家庭的地位。
options.en: Because he wanted to elevate the status of himself and his family.

analysis: 文中提到：“And the miller, because he was nervous and wanted to make himself and his family seem more important, replied, ‘Yes indeed, King. And not only that—she is also able to spin straw into gold.’”磨坊主一是因为紧张，二是因为贪慕虚荣，想要抬高自己和家庭地位，因此欺骗国王，答案选C。

question.cn: 听了磨坊主的谎言后，国王决定做什么？
question.en: What did the king decide to do after heard about the miller’s lie?

options.cn: 他决定监视磨坊主和磨坊主的女儿。
options.en: He decided to spy on the miller and the miller’s daughter.

options.cn: 他决定带磨坊主的女儿去他的城堡并且测试她。
options.en: He decided to take the miller’s daughter to his castle to test her ability.

analysis: 文中提到：“The King replied, ‘That is a very useful skill. If your daughter is really able to do what you say, bring her to my castle tomorrow, and I will test her.’”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么国王一次又一次命令磨坊主的女儿把稻草纺成金子？
question.en: Why did the king order the miller’s daughter to spin straw into gold again and again?

options.en: Because he thought it was very interesting.

options.cn: 因为他是一个非常贪婪的人。
options.en: Because he was a very greedy man.

options.cn: 因为他想要展示自己的权威。
options.en: Because he just wanted to show his power.

analysis: 文中提到：“At sunrise the King came in, and when he saw the gold he was astonished and very happy, because he was a very greedy man. He had the miller’s daughter taken into another room filled with straw, much bigger than the last, and told her that if she valued her life, she must spin it all in one night.”因此答案选B。
